sentence.Network_en: The tools will corrode with rust if never used.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些工具如长期不用会长铁锈而损坏.

sentence.Network_en: An iron tool, if never used, will corrode with rust.
sentence.Network_cn: 铁制工具长期不用会锈损.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin corrodere, from cor- (expressing intensive force) + rodere 'gnaw'

entry.def: If metal or stone corrodes, or is cor-roded, it is gradually destroyed by a chemical or by rust.

example.ex: He has devised a process for making gold wires which neither corrode nor oxidise...
example.tran: 他设计了一种能够避免腐蚀或氧化的金丝制作流程。

example.ex: Engineers found the structure had been corroded by moisture...
example.tran: 工程师们发现该建筑已经受潮腐蚀。

entry.def: To corrode something means to gradually make it worse or weaker.

example.ex: Suffering was easier to bear than the bitterness he felt corroding his spirit...
example.tran: 相较于他感觉正在侵蚀他灵魂的痛苦而言，这种折磨倒更容易承受。

example.ex: He warns that corruption is corroding Russia.
example.tran: 他警告说腐败正在侵蚀俄罗斯。

means.word_mean: 1. cause to deteriorate due to the action of water, air, or an acid;

sentences.sentence: "The steady dripping of water rusted the metal stopper in the sink"

means.word_mean: 2. become destroyed by water, air, or an etching chemical such as an acid;

auth_sentence.content: Those impurities rapidly corrode engine parts.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Those impurities rapidly corrode engine parts.

sentences.en: Rust has corroded the steel rails.

jushi.english: The bitter envy had corroded their friendship.
jushi.chinese: 强烈的嫉妒使他们的友谊遭到破坏。
